body_html:
I pulled today's torch 0.4.0a0+81676d8 build and made the develop build and I still have same test fail. Are you able to run tests_nn and pass all the tests?

Judging by output, it seems like a precision error of 0.00023414 which is a 10e-4 magnitude. Should I ignore this case?

======================================================================
FAIL: test_noncontig_conv_grad (__main__.TestNN) (dtype=<class 'torch.HalfTensor'>)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test_nn.py", line 65, in call_helper
    f(self, *args, dtype=dtype)
  File "test_nn.py", line 3787, in test_noncontig_conv_grad
    self.assertEqual(result, input.grad.data)
  File "/home/subcopmute/pytorch/test/common.py", line 253, in assertEqual
    assertTensorsEqual(x, y)
  File "/home/subcopmute/pytorch/test/common.py", line 245, in assertTensorsEqual
    self.assertLessEqual(max_err, prec, message)
AssertionError: 
1.00000e-04 *
  2.4414
[torch.cuda.HalfTensor of size () (GPU 0)]
 not less than or equal to 1e-05 : 

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1102 tests in 637.778s

FAILED (failures=1, skipped=26)

body:
I pulled today's torch 0.4.0a0+81676d8 build and made the develop build and I still have same test fail. Are you able to run tests_nn and pass all the tests?

Judging by output, it seems like a precision error of 0.00023414 which is a 10e-4 magnitude. Should I ignore this case? 

```
======================================================================
FAIL: test_noncontig_conv_grad (__main__.TestNN) (dtype=<class 'torch.HalfTensor'>)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test_nn.py", line 65, in call_helper
    f(self, *args, dtype=dtype)
  File "test_nn.py", line 3787, in test_noncontig_conv_grad
    self.assertEqual(result, input.grad.data)
  File "/home/subcopmute/pytorch/test/common.py", line 253, in assertEqual
    assertTensorsEqual(x, y)
  File "/home/subcopmute/pytorch/test/common.py", line 245, in assertTensorsEqual
    self.assertLessEqual(max_err, prec, message)
AssertionError: 
1.00000e-04 *
  2.4414
[torch.cuda.HalfTensor of size () (GPU 0)]
 not less than or equal to 1e-05 : 

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1102 tests in 637.778s

FAILED (failures=1, skipped=26)
```
